Syntax highlighting with pygments and Jekyll

04 Dec 2011

Jekyll supports syntax highlighting out of the box. It uses pygments to do code syntax highlighting. Here I found some tips to setup coloring scheme for pygments.

On the pygments site you can play around with different coloring schemes to see how they look for a certain language. Once you have found a nice one create a .css file for example:

pygmentize -S emacs -f html -a .highlight > syntax.css

And when I want to highlight a piece of Clojure code I get something like this:

(defn dup [x] 
   (+ x x))

What I still don’t get is that the background of the syntax blocks do not get the background of pygments. Maybe the screen.css file is causing me trouble?
